column4: So noone knows how to install jdk.  I dont need the automated wannabe help crap.   I have certain reasons for installing jdk and I have errors I can post them. but I need to get it installed!
which jdk do you want?
sudo apt-get install sun-java5-jdk
it should 'just work'
what exactly are you trying to do?
use 'ln'
what exactly do you need to link to?
/usr/bin/java
the jdk doesn't reside in any one place, it is installed like any other application
the 'java' binary is in /usr/bin/
why does it need a symlink anyway? 'java' is in your path
you already have java
your system is already setup like that
the jdk is the software development kit for java
did you install it from the repos?
sun-java5-jdk or sun-java6-jdk
what are the errors?
pastebin the errors
install sun-java5-jdk
if you have installed the jdk, then /usr/bin/java should exist
and from your instructions, that should be sufficient
install sun-java5-jdk, then you will have /usr/bin/java
do not install the rpm, install it from the repos
pastebin any errors you get
